title: Week 5 Assessment: Leadership, Team Support, and Conflict Resolution

questions.question: Which term describes taking ownership of a process and its results?
What is the correct causative form: 'I ________ the reports checked by the auditor.'
What does it mean to 'manage up'?
options: To work effectively with your superior to achieve goals.
To talk to the CEO every day.

questions.question: When you 'delegate' a task, you are:
options: Deleting it from the to-do list.

questions.question: I'll get the receptionist ________ (call) you when the visitor arrives.
To 'touch base' with someone means to:
options: Briefly contact them to update them.
Send them a long, detailed report.
Argue with them about a project.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of 'anticipating needs'?
options: Waiting for your boss to ask for a coffee.
Preparing the meeting room before the attendees arrive.
Asking what the deadline is after it has passed.

questions.question: Which causative structure uses 'to' before the verb?
To 'follow through' on a task means to:
options: Give it to someone else to finish.

questions.question: The manager had the team ________ (review) the new policy. (No 'to')
In the L.E.A.P. framework for conflict resolution, what does the 'E' stand for?
When de-escalating a situation with a frustrated colleague, it is best to:
options: Ignore their complaints until they calm down.
Use a low, calm voice and move to a private space if possible.
Tell them they are being unprofessional.

questions.question: The SBI model for feedback stands for:
Using '________' statements (e.g., 'I feel overwhelmed...') helps reduce defensiveness during conflict.
What is the primary goal of 'de-escalation'?
options: To reduce the intensity and emotional heat of a conflict.
To report the colleague to HR.

questions.question: To 'meet someone halfway' is a professional way of saying:
To '________' someone in means to include them in an existing email thread or discussion.
Constructive criticism should always be:
options: Actionable and intended to help the recipient improve.
Delivered in front of the whole team.

questions.question: When 'managing up', providing 'solutions, not problems' means:
options: Doing the manager's job for them.
Proposing a way forward when you identify a blocker.

questions.question: In the SBI model, '________' describes the specific, observable action without judgment.
